example[0]: There was a touch of sadness in his voice  (=he sounded a little sad).
example[1]: His relief was tinged with sadness (=he also felt rather sad).
example[3]: It was with great sadness that we learned of his death.
definition[1]: a sad feeling, caused especially when a happy time is ending, or when you feel sorry about someone else’s unhappiness
example[4]: Charles felt a great sense of sadness and loss.
example[5]: I noticed a little sadness in her eyes.
definition[2]: the unhappy feeling you have when you are in a very difficult or unpleasant situation, especially when this lasts for a long time
example[6]: After years of unhappiness, she finally decided to leave him.
example[7]: She was a tense, nervous young woman, whose deep unhappiness was obvious to all those around her.
example[8]: You do not know how much pain and unhappiness you have caused.
definition[3]: the feeling of being very sad, especially because someone has died or because terrible things have happened to you
example[9]: There seemed to be nowhere to go to be alone with her sorrow.
example[10]: His heart was filled with great sorrow after her death.
definition[4]: great unhappiness, caused especially by living or working in very bad conditions
example[11]: The cold weather is with us again and the misery of the homeless is increasing.
example[12]: Thousands of families were destined to a life of misery.
example[13]: The misery and pain he caused were, for him, merely a measure of his success.
definition[5]: a feeling of great unhappiness, because very bad things have happened and you have no hope that anything will change
example[14]: At the end of the month, she still had no job and was tired, frustrated, and close to despair.
definition[6]: great sadness that you feel when someone you love has died
example[15]: He was overcome with grief when his wife died.
definition[7]: a strong feeling of great sadness, especially because you miss someone you love
example[16]: She remembered the heartache of the first Christmas spent away from her sons.
definition[8]: a mental illness that makes someone feel so unhappy that they  have no energy or hope for the future, and they cannot live a normal life
example[17]: He slipped into a depression in which he hardly ate or even left his room.
definition[9]: a feeling of being very unhappy and without hope
example[18]: She felt useless, and this contributed to her despondency.
definition[10]: a feeling of sadness, that you feel even though there is no particular reason for it
example[19]: Modigliani expressed his melancholy through his painting.
